intro: Erucaria longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf erucaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Erucaria longifolia is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
